metadata.Title: CVE-2016-8688 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The mtree bidder in libarchive 3.2.1 does not keep track of line sizes when extending the read-ahead, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted file, which triggers an invalid read in the (1) detect_form or (2) bid_entry function in libarchive/archive_read_support_format_mtree.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8688` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bsdcpio - 3.1.2-7ubuntu2.4
bsdtar - 3.1.2-7ubuntu2.4
libarchive13 - 3.1.2-7ubuntu2.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libarchive package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.1.2-7ubuntu2.4').
